summary: I registered a micro enterprise in Paris, France to provide software development services to clients. organization: BMW IT Hub South Africa (Independent Consultant)
summary: I lead a team to migrate over 60 legacy mainframe applications into cloud native. Once completed, this will vastly improve the efficiency of the applications and reduce cost overheads in maintaining them. The main aspects of the work involved:
responsibilities: Evaluating several transpiling technologies (Heirloom, Blu Age & Astadia) to determine the best fit for organisation

Creating a testable & repeatable migration plan for all subsequent transformation projects. This plan needs to cater for Data as well as code migration taking into account batch processes, mainframe data structures and various character encoding
Training plan for devops engineers to ensure they are able to maintain the applications after migration
Implementing a CI/CD pipeline for the migrated applications
Implementing a monitoring system for the migrated applications
successes: Successfully migrated proof of concept application to AWS Blu Age infrastructure

organization: BMW IT Hub South Africa (Independent Consultant)
summary: Working within the ConRecOrd team in the planning department, I oversaw the ordering platform. The project involved maintenance & enhancements to the platform. I was responsible for the ongoing backlog for the legacy system as well as migration to webservices in the BMW cloud. The main aspects of the work involved:
responsibilities: Participating in Live releases and maintaining the Bitbucket/Jenkins build pipeline
Pruning the backlog and working with developers to implement new features in the Sprints
Utilising Top down design in analysis of legacy code to decompose it into smaller cloud services and APIs
Negotiating project timelines and resourcing to minimise business impact during cloud migration
Planning cloud resources to ensure minimum cost overruns
successes: Was able to reduce runtime of a long running stock optimisation job by 67%. This was done with the help of debugging tools and performance metrics analysis

Successfully decomposed our 5 legacy JEE applications into a microservice architecture that was presented to business for implementation
